Institution Name: ALEX EKWUEME FEDERAL UNIVERSITY, NDUFU-ALIKE, EBONYI STATE
Direct Entry Requirements: All candidates seeking admission by Direct Entry (DE) into the 200 Level must have Advanced Level or its approved equivalent with at least Credit level passes in at least two (2) social science subjects, one of which must be Government. Candidates with acceptable pass in JUBEB and Upper Credit in Ordinary National Diploma (OND) and Higher National Diploma (HND) from approved Polytechnic and Monotechnic Diploma-Awarding Institutions and/or their approved equivalent in the following disciplines: Peaceand Conflict Studies, Criminal Justice Administration, Paralegal Studies, Social Policy, Public Administration, Law, Security and Intelligence, and other related disciplines as well as First Degree in any discipline are also eligible for admission through DE, in addition to satisfying the O’Level minimum requirements. In addition, a minimum of 12 years of practical experience in related fields such as military, police and other State law enforcement agencies, in addition to satisfying the basic O’Level requirements, may be considered for admission into DE—the Officer must be in active service and not below the rank of Major or its equivalent.
UTME Requirements: For admission into the four-year-degree programme in Criminology and Security Studies, a candidate must have Senior Secondary School Certificate Examination (SSCE) or its equivalent with at least credit level passes in five (5) subjects: English Language, Mathematics, Government, and any other two subjects from: Geography, Economics, History, Civic Education, Financial Accounting, Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Christian Religious Knowledge, French, and Nigerian Languages (i.e. Hausa, Igbo or Yoruba) at not more than two sittings. The candidate must also earn an acceptable score in the Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination (UTME).
Subjects: The required UTME subjects are English Language, Government, and any other two subjects from either of Life/Health Sciences, Behavioural/Social Sciences or Arts/Humanities background.

Direct Entry Requirements:
Candidates seeking Direct Entry admission into the 200level of the B.Sc. Economics degree program shall possess any of the following qualifications:

a.     GCE Advanced level passes in at least two subjects which must include Economics.

b.     Acceptable passes in JUPEB or its equivalent;

c.      National Diploma Upper Credit or its equivalent in a related field.

d.     Higher National Diploma (HND) Lower Credit in a related field.

e.     NCE credit or its equivalent in related field;

f.    First degree in a related area from a
UTME Requirements: Credit Passes in English, Mathematics, Economics and any two relevant subjects from the following: Further mathematics, Government, Accounting, Geography, Lit. in English, Commerce, Book Keeping, Civic Education, History, CRK/IRK, any Nigerian Language/French, Physics, Chemistry
Subjects: Use of English, Mathematics, Economics and any one of the Further Mathematics, Government, Accounting, Geography, Lit. in English, commerce, Book Keeping, Civic Education, History, CRK/IRK

Direct Entry Requirements:
Candidates for Direct Entry admission into three years degree programme in Educational Management will join the programme at 200 level. They would possess any of the following qualifications in addition to the basic university admission requirements of the subject area departments whose courses would be considered as restricted electives.

1.Two passes in relevant subject areas at advanced level, with SSCE/GCE “O” level credit pass in 5 subjects including English and Mathematics at not more than two sittings, OR

2. A two year diploma of a recognized institution in Nigeria or overseas with pass level not below merit.

3. At least a merit pass in two major subjects in relevant areas at NCE from recognized institution in Nigeria or overseas.
UTME Requirements: Five (5) SSCE credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and three other relevant subjects
Subjects: Economics, Mathematics and one (1) other Social Science/Arts subject.
